meanings.definition: The ability of two organisms to produce offspring together.
meanings.sent1: The interfertility of the rabbits allowed them to have baby bunnies.
meanings.sent2: The interfertility of the flowers ensured successful pollination.
meanings.sent3: The interfertility of the ducks led to a quacktastic family reunion.
meanings.sent4: The interfertility of the trees created a forest full of life.
meanings.sent5: The interfertility of the dogs made the neighborhood lively with puppies.

meanings.definition: The state of being capable of reproducing with another organism.
meanings.sent1: The interfertility of the birds meant they could mate and have chicks.
meanings.sent2: The interfertility of the fish population was crucial for the ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The interfertility of the cats made them the talk of the alley.
meanings.sent4: The interfertility of the insects symbolized the circle of life.
meanings.sent5: The interfertility of the horses painted the fields with new foals.
